H0.text: What alliterative two-word term describes a product or service sold at less than cost, typically to encourage customers to buy other more profitable products/services. Price Ploy

H1.text: What alliterative two-word term describes a product or service sold at less than cost, typically to encourage customers to buy other more profitable products/services. Cheap Charm

H2.text: What alliterative two-word term describes a product or service sold at less than cost, typically to encourage customers to buy other more profitable products/services. Discount Deal

H3.text: What alliterative two-word term describes a product or service sold at less than cost, typically to encourage customers to buy other more profitable products/services. Lossleader

A4.text: A loss leader (also leader) is a pricing strategy where a product is sold at a price below its market cost to stimulate other sales of more profitable goods or services.
